subject: Golf
lead_paragraph: A week after his surprising third-place finish in the British Open, Andrés Romero shot a nine-under-par 63 yesterday to take the third-round lead at the Deutsche Bank Players’ Championship in Alveslohe, Germany. Romero, who has never won on the European Tour, is at 17-under 199, two strokes ahead of Zane Scotland going into today’s final round. Romero, who squandered a late lead at the Open, collected two eagles and five birdies and went bogey free. “I try to birdie every single hole,” Romero said. “I’m going to go out and play as I did today.”.
